This after the head of the Wagner mercenary group, Evgeny Pogotin, accused a Russian military unit near Bakhmut of abandoning its positions, leaving 500 casualties behind.

sentences.sentence: London has broken one of the taboos of Western aid to Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: The British government announced it will send long-range missiles, missiles that can be launched by Ukrainian pilots up to 250 kilometres from their targets. In a calibrated and determined manner.

sentences.sentence: The donation of these weapon systems gives Ukraine the best chance to defend themselves against Russia's continued brutality, especially the deliberate targeting of Ukrainian civilian infrastructure which is against international law. sentences.sentence: There have been several buildings and vehicles engulfed in flames. So far there's one person injured.

sentences.sentence: It's the driver of the van who, according to local reports, managed to get out of the vehicle just moments before the explosion broke out. The fire has now been almost completely put out and the area is cordoned off.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Turkish presidential candidate Muharrem Ince says he's pulling out of Sunday's presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Polling at around 2%, Ince said he didn't want to be responsible for splitting the opposition vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I am doing this for my country. The leader of the center-left Homeland Party, Ince, was one of four contenders running for president against incumbent Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ince had faced heavy criticism for pulling crucial votes away from the six-party nation alliance that has united behind opposition leader Kemal Kilicderoglu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Polls have given Kilicderoglu a slight lead over Erdogan, although neither candidate was expected to gain more than 50 percent of the vote and win the election outright.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Now Erdogan's opponents hope NJ's withdrawal could tip the balance in their favor.

sentences.sentence: Police were called to the sprawling Sindelfingen plant near Stuttgart just before 8 a.m. local time in response to reports of gunfire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A number of people were also injured in the shooting, including police officers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12

sentences.sentence: Men, women with children and babies try to cross the southern border of the United States to seek asylum in a mass movement of migrants that's mixing confusion and anxiety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: On Thursday night, the United States will lift the measure known as Title 42 that's basically blocked access to its territory since the start of the pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: New requirements are going into effect, but some migrants fear they could be even worse.

sentences.sentence: Even President Joe Biden has acknowledged that the situation could be chaotic.

sentences.sentence: In response, the federal government has mobilized more than 24,000 agents and police at the border.

sentences.sentence: We are seeing a lot more females with children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.sentence: When the new restrictions go into effect on Thursday night, asylum seekers will be subjected to a whole new battery of controls.

sentences.sentence: They must, for example, make an appointment to apply for asylum through an online app.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: If they fail to do so, they could be deported and banned from entering the country for five years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: could be deported and banned from entering the country for five years. In the West, the war in Ukraine is perceived as aggressive, invasive and accompanied by numerous crimes against humanity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And initially, some Russians openly shared similar sentiments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Anti-war protests in the country were relatively prominent in the first months after the full-scale invasion began, but then died down rather quickly. Many citizens see what's happening as a just war against the collective West, which is exactly what Putin wants them to think.

sentences.sentence: The Soviet Union era played a huge role in unteaching people how to think for themselves and be critical.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In addition, contemporary Russian propaganda is strikingly different from Soviet propaganda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Although it uses much of the same traditional ideology, the technical approach is completely different.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: So even if there is experience of countering Soviet propaganda, it doesn't necessarily work against the current narrative.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Of course, modern propaganda in Russia is much more effective than Soviet propaganda, because, first of all, it takes into account that people can get information from different sources, and it tries to present a picture that is not necessarily beneficial to the authorities, but one that the citizens themselves like. According to experts Euronews spoke to, it's possible many Russians don't fall for the state propaganda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They simply fear to express their position because they're scared of repercussions and persecution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: But it's not only fear that's preventing Russian citizens speaking out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's also disappointment and apathy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Deep disillusionment with the Soviet regime, as well as the so-called democracy in the 1990s, has shaped Russians' apoliticism, especially as many think the war doesn't affect them. Большинство или нет, трудно сказать, но значительная часть граждан не хочет войны, но в то же время их не настолько волнует эта война, чтобы они активно выступили против нее.
